entry.title: Show Your Gtalk Presence on WordPress
entry.content:
I couldn't find a plugin that showed my presence in a way that I liked so I threw together the following php script. It's influenced by the Gtalk (Status) to WordPress (G2W) plugin by Aw Guo. It includes simplehtmldom, a very easy to use HTML DOM parser.

The first step is to get a Gtalk Chatback Badge "http://www.google.com/talk/service/badge/New" Gtalk Chatback Badge. Edit the badge, making sure "Show your status message" is ticked. Copy the hashcode in the url of your badge. It's the string after after ?tk. Replace HASHCODE in the following code with your hashcode.

php gtalkStatus.php <?php include './simplehtmldom/simple_html_dom.php'; // Create DOM from URL or file<br /> $html = file_get_html('http://www.google.com/talk/service/badge/Show?tk=HASHCODE'); foreach($html->find('img#b') as $element){ $status['image']='<img src="http://google.com/'.$element->src . '"/>' $status['type']=$element->alt; } $status['text']=preg_replace("/[^a-zA-Z0-9s t]/", "", $html->find('div.r', 1)->plaintext) ; //print_r($status); echo $status['image']." ".$status['text']; ?>

Check it out in action.

Add the following to the page where you want to show your status.

<?php echo file_get_contents('url/to/php/script');?>
